content:
• Friday, January 5, 2018
  • CYTX

    Cytori Therapeutics jumps as Maxim sees it as takeover candidate

    • Nanocap Cytori Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CYTX) vaulted in the last 15 minutes of the week's trading to a 74% gain after it was floated as a likely acquisition candidate by Maxim.
    • Analyst Jason Kolbert sees Takeda's (TKPYY) play for Tigenix (NASDAQ:TIG) as a positive sign for Cytori, since it makes a similar adipose-based product for regenerative medicine.
    • He has a price target of $5 vs. today's close of $0.47.
    • Volume was about 7.7M shares today vs. an average of less than 1M. Shares have drawn back slightly postmarket, -13%.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 6:42 PM | 9 Comments
  • QCOM

    Register: Qualcomm processors vulnerable to recent exploits

    • Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) has confirmed that its processors are affected by recent exploits, according to The Register.
    • "So kind of @Qualcomm to confirm at 2.30pm PT on a Friday that its processors are affected by Meltdown and Spectre, too," the publication just tweeted.
    • Shares have turned down in aftermarket trading, -0.7%.
    • The news comes a day after acknowledgment by Apple that all its devices are subject to the processor exploits. After a couple of days of losses, Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) closed higher today by 0.7%; and AMD lost ground after a couple of strong days, finishing 2% lower.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM | 44 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: JT +1.5%. AUO +1.4%. HPI +1.3%.
    • Top losers: WPRT -2.2%. GPT -1.3%. APLP -1.2%. YGE -1.2%. CTRP -1.0%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 3 Comments
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile sells Moscow studio for $4.5M; shares +2.1%

    • Glu Mobile (NASDAQ:GLUU) has sold its Moscow studio and some of the games it made, for about $4.5M.
    • Shares are up 2.1% after hours.
    • The studio had focused on shooter/action games, including franchises around Contact Killer, Frontline Commando, and Blood & Glory -- all of which will move to the company's studio in Hyderabad, India. Live operations for Deer Hunter 2017 will also join Deer Hunter Classic in Hyderabad.
    • Other games made in Moscow -- Last Day Alive, Heroes of Destiny, and a mobile game/license agreement for an unnamed male celebrity -- are being sold.
    • Glu is getting about $3M in cash and $1.5M in minimum guaranteed royalty payments. It had originally acquired the Moscow operation in 2008.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM | 14 Comments

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: EWZ +5.9%. REMX +5.8%. ILF +5.6%. KOL +5.3%. URA +5.2%.
    • Top losers: VXX -5.8%. XLU -2.6%. IDU -2.4%. VNQ -2.3%. IYR -2.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 7 Comments

  • More records fall; Nasdaq up 3.4% in 2018, S&P 500 2.5%

    • The stock rally showed zero signs of letting up in the year's first week, with the Dow up 0.9%, and now setting its sights on 26K. The S&P 500 rose 0.7% and the Nasdaq 0.8%. All three indices closed at new records in all four sessions of 2018.
    • For the week, the Dow gained 1.4%, the S&P 500 2.5%, and the Nasdaq 3.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 49 Comments
  • XSPA

    FORM Holdings becoming XpresSpa Group, changing symbol

    • FORM Holdings (FH) is making its recent business-unit focus more official, announcing it's changing its corporate name to XpresSpa Group.
    • The holding company has been pivoting toward a pure-play wellness services company and continues expanding its XpresSpa locations, with several recent airport openings.
    • It will keep trading on Nasdaq, but under a new symbol: Starting Monday, it will trade as XSPA.
    • Shares rose 9.4% today; they're down 5.3% in immediate postmarket quotes.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 7 Comments
  • VUZI

    Vuzix closes +18.6% on news of Alexa-enabled smart glasses

    • Vuzix (NASDAQ:VUZI) shares closed today up 18.6% after the company announced plans to unveil the first Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) Alexa-enabled smart glasses at CES.
    • The glasses will have an initial price of $1K and a “prosumer” audience of business customers, but the company says the price will eventually come down.  
    • Previously: Amazon announces dev kit to bring Alexa to wearables (Jan. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM | 24 Comments
  • GBTC

    Bitcoin's back, at least for today

    • Bitcoin's kind of been stuck in a rut for the past three weeks while money has flowed into a number of alt coins. That's reversed a bit today though.
    • With most of the crypto sector lit up bright red, Bitcoin is higher by nearly 9% to $16.5K. About the only other cryptos in the green are other mainstream coins Ether, Litecoin, and Bitcoin Cash.
    • Ripple is down 3% today, and off about 23% from yesterday's high.
    • OTCQX:GBTC +6.2%
    • Related tickers: OTCQX:GBTC, COIN, RIOT, OSTK, SSC-OLD, MARA, UEPS, OTC:BITCF, XNET, GROW, OTCPK:BTSC, OTCQB:BTCS, OTCQB:MGTI, OTCPK:BTLLF SRAX, OTCPK:GAHC, OTC:UBIA, OTC:ARSC, OTCPK:USTC, PRELF, OTCPK:BLKCF, OTC:CRCW, COINB, OTCPK:LFIN
    • Previously: Coinbase: No coins being added (Jan. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 89 Comments
  • ACOR

    Acorda up 12% on potential sale

    • The WSJ reports that Acorda Therapeutics (ACOR +11.9%) is exploring a potential sale. The company has been facing generic competition for top seller Ampyra (dalfampridine) since the USPTO invalidated several key patents earlier this year. In Q3, the MS med accounted for almost 99% of its Q3 product revenue of $134.4M ($132.6M).
    • Last month, the company resubmitted its U.S. marketing application for INBRIJA for the treatment of OFF periods in Parkinson's disease patients.
    • Previously: Acorda refiles U.S. marketing application for Parkinson's med Inbrija; shares up 5% premarket (Dec. 7, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • ERJ

    Embraer down 5% on profit-taking, talks with Boeing advancing

    • Embraer (ERJ -4.5%) slips on more than double normal volume on profit-taking after its 35% runup on Boeing (BA +3.6%) takeover interest. The selloff was stoked by a WSJ report that the companies have informally agreed to terms valuing the Brazilian firm at $28 per share.
    • Boeing is in talks with the company and Brazilian government on ways to assuage the latter's concerns about a transaction considering the former's defense business.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM | 15 Comments
  • WU

    Western Union spikes off of XRP talk

    • Western Union (WU +3.8%) spikes in late trading off of reports the company is considering adopting a new XRP payment system.
    • XRP is the token used in the Ripple protocol.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM | 6 Comments
  • YGE

    Yingli riding high after near-40% gain in 2017 component output

    • Yingli Green Energy (NYSE:YGE) is up 28.2% after saying in a social media post that its 2017 solar component output was up nearly 40%.
    • Output and sales volume were almost 3 gigawatts, the company says, hitting its annual target.
    • Shares hit $2.83 today in NYSE trading for the first time since last April.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM | 1 Comment

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:55 pm

    • Gainers: CNIT-OLD +38%. YGE +37%. DWCH +24%. TCCO +20%. CCIH +20%.
    • Losers: RENN -13%. SQNS -12%. DPW -10%. JRJC -8%. CBB -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • FIT

    Fitbit invests $6M in diabetes monitoring startup

    • Fitbit (NYSE:FIT) invests $6M in startup Sano, developer of a small patch that tracks blood sugar levels.
    • Fitbit’s investment could hint towards a desire to turn its wearables into medical devices, a path that Apple is pursuing with its Watch.
    • Fitbit has existing partnerships with wearable devices makers Medtronic and Dexcom that allows its smartwatch wearers to display glucose-monitoring data.   
    • Fitbit could use the boost in sales as it sold 3.6M devices in the most recent quarter, which was down from 5.3M in the prior year’s period. 
    • Fitbit shares are down 1.3%.    
    • Previously: Fitbit +2.5% as Roth initiates at Buy (Jan. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM | 24 Comments
  • DELT

    Delta Tech up big on rumored blockchain move, shares ahead 142%

    • Shrugging off the widespread opinion that all things related to cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology are in a bubble, investors pile into Delta Technology Holdings (DELT +141.9%) on a whopping 151x surge in volume. The stampede was apparently ignited by a report on the news website eTradeWire that rumors are circulating that the Chinese chemical outfit may jump into blockchain.
    • Nano cap Delta normally trades 185K shares a day. Turnover sits at almost 28M less than two years to the close.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM | 9 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: DELT +221%. PKD-OLD +12%. USAU +12%. CGA +11%. CHNR +10%.
    • Losers: RCON -13%. OTC:IGC -8%. MXC -8%. PES -7%. ECR -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • CBMG

    Cellular Bio continues rally, shares up 19%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Cellular Biomedicine Group (CBMG +18.9%) is up on more than a 5x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of only 205K shares. The stock has rallied almost 70% since it announced the closing of a $14.5M private capital raise on December 28.
    • Previously: Cellular Biomedicine closes $14.5M private placement offering (Dec. 28, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 7 Comments
  • PHIO

    RXi Pharma to reverse split shares 1:10 on Monday; shares down 13%

    • Aimed at regaining Nasdaq's minimum bid price listing requirement, RXi Pharmaceuticals (RXII -12.5%) will execute a 1:10 reverse split of its common stock at 12:01 am ET on Monday, January 8. Post-split trading will commence at the open.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • LPCN

    Lipocine slumps 10% ahead of Ad Com review for Tlando

    • Lipocine (LPCN -10.3%) is down on a 5x surge in volume ahead of next Wednesday's FDA Ad Com review for oral testosterone replacement therapy TLANDO (testosterone undecanoate).
    • The day before, the advisory committee plans to discuss Clarus Therapeutics' application for JATENZO (testosterone undecanoate) for the same indication.
    • Previously: Ad Com next week for Clarus Therapeutics' oral testosterone (Jan. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM | 7 Comments

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:15 PM

    • Gainers: IIPR +12%. LND +10%.CCCR-OLD +10%. HCI +8%. PZN +7%.
    • Losers: OPHC -7%. JTPY -7%. HGSH -7%. DB -6%. SGLB -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM | 2 Comments
  • NVDA

    Goldman Sachs calls Nvidia, Entegris top picks

    • Goldman Sachs reiterates its Buy rating for Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) and expects the company to report earnings that beat expectations.
    • Analyst Toshiya Hari notes that Nvidia is “exposed to multiple secular growth markets” and sees gaming as a “meaningful and sustainable growth driver” for the company. 
    • Goldman says its top picks in Semis and Semi Cap are Nvidia and Entegris (NASDAQ:ENTG). 
    • Hari expects a new Volta GPU launch in Q2 or Q3 and forecasts FY19 EPS of $6, compared to the $4.53 consensus. 
    • Price target reaffirmed at $228, a 7% upside on yesterday’s closing price. 
    • Nvidia shares are up 0.9%. 
    • Entegris shares are up 0.9%.        
    • Previously: Western Digital -1.6% on analyst downgrade, price target cut (Jan. 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 14 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: DELT +224%. CNIT-OLD +57%. SKY +42%. YGE +29%. CCIH +26%. ORPN +26%. DWCH +24%. CBMG +17%. APRI +15%. CRSP +14%.
    • Losers: OHRP -81%. CNET -26%. KALA -25%. ADOM -23%. CORE -22%. NOVN -20%. FRAN -20%. RENN -15%. BKS -15%. RGNX -15%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • SEAS

    Midday spike for SeaWorld Entertainment

    • Shares of SeaWorld Entertainment (SEAS +1.8%) jolt awake on a volume spike after sitting in negative territory for most of the day.
    • At the moment there isn't any clear indication what all the excitement is about. The company is due to deliver a presentation next week at the ICR Conference.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • DWCH

    Reuters: Datawatch hires financial adviser for acquisition interest

    • Datawatch (NASDAQ:DWCH) shares keep gaining on yesterday’s news that the company hired a financial adviser after receiving acquisition interest.
    • Reuters sources say the talks are in early stages and could fail to lead to a deal or result in another outcome like a commercial partnership. 
    • Datawatch’s FY17 annual revenue rose 19% compared to the previous year to $36.26M and the net loss narrowed to $4M from $14.63M. 
    • Datawatch shares are up 25%. Shares of competitor Alteryx (NYSE:AYX) are up 2.3%.    
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 3 Comments
  • NFLX

    Netflix bumps with news of Letterman show debut featuring Obama

    • Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) is seeing a Letterman tick-up, now up 1.3%, after tweeting out that former CBS Late Show veteran David Letterman's new monthly interview show, My Next Guest Needs No Introduction, will debut in a week with an all-star guest lineup.
    • The Jan. 12 edition will debut with President Barack Obama and include George Clooney, Malala Yousafzai, Tina Fey, Howard Stern and Jay-Z, Netflix says.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM | 109 Comments

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: XNY +19%. FFHL +18%. BORN +11%. ONP +9%. ZX +9%.
    • Losers: ADOM -24%. SGOC -8%. CALM -8%. TVPT -6%. CROX -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • SKY

    Skyline and Champion Home Builders announce agreement on business combination; Shares +36%

    • Skyline Corporation (NYSEMKT:SKY) and Champion Enterprises Holdings, LLC, the parent company of Champion Home Builders, Inc. announced that they have entered into a definitive agreement to combine their operations.
    • The transaction is expected to be completed in the 1H18, (Subject to regulatory, shareholders approval & other customary closing conditions).
    • Art Decio, Skyline's largest shareholder, has agreed to vote in favor of and fully support the transaction.
    • Under the terms of the agreement, Champion will contribute 100% of the shares of its operating subsidiaries, Champion Home Builders, Inc. and CHB International B.V., to Skyline. In exchange, Skyline is currently expected to issue ~47.8M shares to Champion, representing 84.5% of the common stock of the combined company on a fully-diluted basis.
    • Prior to closing, Skyline expects to declare a dividend to its existing shareholders of its excess net cash available for distribution under the agreement after certain transactional expenses.
    • Skyline expects significantly increased size and scale, with pro forma combined revenue of greater than $1B (past 12 months), Strong pro forma balance sheet and significant cash flow to support continued flexibility and long-term strategic growth & significant annual synergies post transaction.
    • The combined company will be known as Skyline Champion Corporation and trade on the NYSE American under the ticker symbol "SKY."
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • AMZN

    Amazon announces dev kit to bring Alexa to wearables

    • Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) announces a new Alexa Mobile Accessory Kit that makes it easier for developers to bring Alexa into smartwatches, headphones, and other wearables. 
    • The toolset will launch later this year and is aimed at low-power devices that communicate with the Alexa app in an iOS or Android smartphone, which processes the request. 
    • Involved partners include Bose, iHome, and Jabra.    
    • Amazon shares are up 0.7%.   
    • Previously: Alexa can now control microwaves, ovens; Amazon invests in smart oven startup (Jan. 4)
    • Previously: Amazon in talks for Premier League streaming rights (Jan. 5)
    • Previously: CBS adds ad-light live streaming service to Amazon Channels (Jan. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 16 Comments
  • LBCC

    Long Blockchain gets busy with new direction

    • Long Blockchain Corp. announces that Nasdaq has approved a change of the company's stock trading ticker symbol to OTCPK:LBCC from LTEA.
    • Effective today, Long Blockchain will trade with the new symbol.
    • The company also disclosed a share offering of 1.6M shares at $5.25. The offering is set to close on January 9.
    • Also in the works today is a deal signed by Long Blockchain with certain third parties to purchase 1,000 Antminer S9 mining rigs and 1,000 APW3++ PSUs manufactured by Bitmain.
    • The mining equipment is expected to be shipped this month directly to a secure data center in the Nordic region to immediately commence mining operations.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM | 9 Comments
  • MNTA

    Momenta's M281 demonstrates proof of mechanism in early-stage study; shares ahead 12%

    • Momenta Pharmaceuticals (MNTA +11.5%) is up on almost 20% higher volume on the heels of its announcement of positive results from a Phase 1 single-ascending dose study of M281 in healthy volunteers.
    • M281 was safe, well-tolerated and demonstrated proof of mechanism by decreasing circulating IgG levels up to 89% (mean reduction was 84%).
    • Topline results will be presented at JPM18. Complete data will be presented at an upcoming company event and at a future medical conference.
    • A proof-of-concept study will launch in H2 pending regulatory feedback.
    • M281 is a fully human anti-neonatal Fc receptor (FcRN) immunoglobulin G (IgG1) designed to reduce circulating pathogenic IgG antibodies in the blood. It works by blocking IgG recycling via FcRN.
    • #JPM18
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: CBMG +17%. APRI +15%. ATEC +15%. MNTA +12%. CRSP +12%.
    • Losers: OHRP -81%. KALA -30%. NOVN -16%. RGNX -15%. SCYX -14%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • SSNNF

    TrendForce drops Q1 DRAM estimate after Samsung, China meeting

    • TrendForce’s DRAMeXchange narrows its mobile DRAM average sequential increase to 3% in Q1, down from 5%. The cut comes after Samsung (OTC:SSNNF, OTC:SSNLF) met with Chinese authorities concerned about its role in rising memory prices.
    • China’s National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC) held the meeting after receiving appeals from domestic smartphone makers feeling pressure from component costs. 
    • “By petitioning NDRC to investigate Samsung for monopolistic practices, Chinese smartphone brands hope that Samsung and DRAM suppliers following its lead will consider carefully before initiating the next round of price hikes,” says DRAMeXchange research analyst Avril Wu. 
    • The research firm estimates that average DRAM selling price increased over 40% last year with the average NAND price rising nearly 40% in the same period. 
    • Samsung led both NAND and DRAM markets in Q3, accounting for nearly 46% of global DRAM revenue and 37% of global NAND revenue.   
    • Shares of major DRAM player Micron (NASDAQ:MU) are down 2.3%following the report.     
    • Previously: Samsung unveils new processor that could power Galaxy S9 and copy Apple (Jan. 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 91 Comments
  • YY

    YY looking to fuel margin growth with esports IPO

    • Plans by YY (YY +1.9%) to list its esports platform Huya in the U.S. may provide a hot IPO if financials stay on the same track, Bloomberg's Tim Culpan says.
    • The unit, similar to live-streaming service Twitch, is looking to raise at least $200M in a U.S. listing.
    • It's not been making money, but losses have narrowed, he notes (to 14.1M yuan in Q3 from a prior-year loss of 170M yuan), while margin at YY's other key unit -- YY Live -- has been shrinking even amid revenue growth.
    • That business, which lets amateur tubers sing or teach classes and seek digital gifts from users, is spending more in marketing but seeing diminishing returns as it fights rivals including Momo (MOMO +1.9%).
    • The Chinese esports market is expected to generate 3B yuan in revenue (about $462M) and draw 140M users this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM | 14 Comments
  • NKE

    Buckingham Research updates on Nike and Under Armour

    • Buckingham Research weighs in on Nike (NKE +0.8%) and Under Armour (UAA +5%) in new notes published today.
    • Nike is initiated with a Buy rating: "Innovation Refresh + Accretive Levers = Superior Growth."
    • Under Armour UA is started off at Neutral: "Operational Execution Key for Turn."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM | 8 Comments
  • BKS

    Painful drop for Barnes & Noble

    • Barnes & Noble (BKS -14.2%) falls to a multi-year low after posting disappointing results for the two-month holiday period.
    • Sales from the book business were down 4.5% for the period and total comparable sales fell 6.4%.
    • The well-known bookstore chain now trades with a market cap of around $402M. Though the dividend yield is now over 10%, some investors have questioned if the payout level is sustainable.
    • Previously: Barnes & Noble updates on holiday sales (Jan. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 4 Comments
  • NOVN

    Novan prices stock offering at $3.80; shares down 18%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Novan (NOVN -18.2%) is down on almost a 5x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of only 224K shares, in response to the pricing of its equity offering.
    • The company is offering 10M common shares and 10M warrants at a combined price of $3.80. Each four-year warrant is exercisable at $4.66 per share.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • UNP

    More Wall Street love for rails

    • Another strong call on railroad stocks arrives this morning as Wall Street continues to point to upside for 2018 from tax reform benefits, falling capex spending and margin gains.
    • Wolfe Research issues a sector-wide upgrade to Overweight and now has Union Pacific (UNP +1.5%), CSX (CSX +1.1%) and Norfolk Southern (NSC +1.4%) all lined up at Outperform.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • Previously: Citi sees more gains for railroad stocks (Jan. 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM | 13 Comments
  • AIPT

    Skyline Medical prices equity offering at $0.95/Unit; shares down 6%

    • Skyline Medical (SKLN -6.1%) prices its public offering of 2.9M Units at $0.95 per Unit.
    • Each Unit consists of one share of common stock and 0.3 of a Series E Warrant to purchase one share of common at $1.00.
    • Underwriter's over-allotment is an additional 290K shares of stock and/or 87K Series E Warrants. Closing date is January 9.
    • Gross proceeds should be $2.755M.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM | 7 Comments
  • DYNT

    Dynatronics announces distribution agreement with Orthopedic Outfitters; shares +5%

    • Dynatronics Corporation (DYNT +4.9%) announced a new distribution agreement for the Company's Dynatronics™ division's products (including the Dynatron Solaris® Plus, ThermoStim™ Probe, and 125B Portable Ultrasound) with Orthopedic Outfitters.
    • The Orthopedic Outfitters is a leading distributor of physical therapy and rehabilitation products in Northern California.
    • CEO of Dynatronics,  Kelvyn H. Cullimore Jr.: "Orthopedic Outfitters has built a reputation for excellent customer service and is recognized as a top dealer in the state of California. They are an ideal partner to distribute our products in Northern California. With this agreement, we continue to execute on one of the core pillars of our organic growth strategy – strengthening our domestic distribution."
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • PSMT

    PriceSmart updates on Dec. sales

    • PriceSmart (PSMT -6.8%) reports sales increased 4.9% in December to $344.2M.
    • Comparable warehouse sales were up 6.4% during the month.
    • The company had 40 warehouse clubs in operation at the end of December, compared to 39 warehouse clubs a year ago.
    • Shares of PriceSmart are sharply lower on the day after FQ1 results fell short of estimates.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Previously: Net income falls at PriceSmart (Jan. 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • HAIN

    No buyer for Hain - NYPost; shares down nearly 2%

    • The company has been unable to find a buyer despite being informally on the block for about a year, according to the report.
    • Founder and CEO Irwin Simon built Hain (HAIN -1.9%) with the intention of ultimately selling, but sources say the large number of brands is scaring off buyers.
    • Next up, therefore, may be some divestitures, in particular the chicken and turkey division.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM | 6 Comments
  • WING

    Wingstop slips after Wedbush warning

    • Wingstop (WING -2.2%) swings lower after Wedbush Securities takes a cautious view on the restaurant stock after the recent rally in share price
    • Analyst Nick Setyan warns that Wingstop's Q4 comparable sales were below estimates (+4% vs. +5% consensus) and thinks the benefit from 2018 advertising may be below expectations.
    • The selling pressure today on Wingstop took shares back below $40.
    • Sources: Bloomberg, Nasdaq.com
     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • PTX

    Pernix shakes up commercial business, cuts 22% of workforce; shares up 3% premarket

    • Thinly traded nano cap Pernix Therapeutics (NYSEMKT:PTX) announces a reorganization of its commercial operations aimed at sharpening its focus on Zohydro ER (hydrocodone bitartrate) and Silenor (doxepin).
    • 22% of its full-time workforce will be axed and the sales organization will be realigned into 74 territories.
    • Management expects the initiative to save $7M - 8M in annual operating expenses. It will record a $1M charge this quarter for related costs.
    • Shares are up 3% premarket on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM | 11 Comments
  • LBCC

    Long Blockchain in deal for 1K mining machines, offering shares

    • The company formerly known as Long Island Iced Tea (LTEA) today begins trading under a new symbol: OTCPK:LBCC.
    • Alongside is an agreement to buy 1K Antminer S9 mining rigs and 1K APW3++ PSUs from Bitmain. The equipment is set to be shipped this month to a data center in the Nordic region.
    • The company is also offering 1.6M shares through Alexander Capital.
    • Shares are down 8.45% premarket to $5.80.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM | 8 Comments
  • FIT

    Fitbit +2.5% as Roth initiates at Buy

    • Fitbit (NYSE:FIT) is up 2.5% premarket after a start at Buy by Roth Capital, which sees a pioneering company in fitness tracking that has "legitimate" digital therapeutic aspirations.
    • Roth set the company's price target at $10, implying 67% upside.
    • Shares have declined 59.5% over the past 12 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM | 43 Comments

  • Premarket Gainers as of 9:05 am

    • CNIT-OLD +63% on ad terminal sale.
    • CCIH +33%.
    • CCCR-OLD +16%.
    • CFMS +14%.
    • GENE +13%.
    • CREG +12%.
    • ACST +11%.
    • ZFGN +10% on clinical progress and updates outlook for 2018.
    • CGA +8%.
    • ANY +8% on announcement that HVE ConneXions has recently secured purchase orders with a number of customers.
    • RIOT +8% as no coins are being added to coinbase.

  • KALA

    Kala Pharma's lead candidate shows mixed results in two late-state dry eye disease studies; shares down 16% premarket

    • Thinly traded micro cap Kala Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KALA) slumps 16% premarket on average volume on the heels of its announcement of results from two Phase 3 clinical trials, STRIDE 1 and STRIDE 2, evaluating lead candidate KPI-121 (loteprednol etabonate) in patients with dry eye disease.
    • STRIDE 1 achieved its primary sign endpoint of the change in conjunctival hyperemia from baseline to day 15 (p<0.0001) and the primary symptom endpoint of the severity of ocular discomfort from baseline to day 15 (p<0.0001), but missed a secondary endpoint, the change in inferior corneal staining from baseline to day 15 (p=0.1128).
    • STRIDE 2 met the primary sign endpoint, but missed the primary symptom endpoint (p=0.1298) and missed the secondary ocular discomfort endpoint (p=0.0799).
    • On the safety front, the most common adverse event in STRIDE 1 was instillation site pain (6.1% in both treatment and placebo groups). The only other adverse event occurring in more than 1% of patients was eye irritation (1.1% in the KPI-121 cohort versus 1.5% for placebo).
    • In STRIDE 2, the incidence of instillation pain was 5.7% in the treatment group compared to 4.4% for placebo. Blurred vision was reported in 0.2% of the patients in the KPI-121 group versus 1.3% for placebo. Elevations in intraocular pressure (IOP), a known side effect from topical corticosteroid use, were similar between the two groups. 1.1% of the KPI-121 cohort experienced an increase in IOP of at least 5 mmHg which resulted in an IOP of at least 21 mmHg (normal range: 12 - 22 mmHg).

    • Among the reasons cited for Ripple's scorching run (at its high yesterday, up 15-fold in a month) was the rumor that Coinbase (COINB) as soon as next week was going to add the coin to its small list of tradable assets (joining Bitcoin, Ether, Litecoin, and Bitcoin Cash).

  • INTC

    Tech giants see little performance impact from Intel chip issues

    • The Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) chip issues have only slowed computers slightly, according to impacted tech giants, and security researchers have backed off the need for hardware replacements.
    • Intel says Apple, Amazon, Google, and Microsoft all reported little to no performance impact from the required security patches.
    • Microsoft and Google separately say they expect few performance issues for cloud computing customers. Apple also independently confirmed that its tests showed no significant processing speed impact from the patches. 
    • Carnegie Mellon’s cybersecurity project CERT withdraws recommending CPU replacement for an affected system. CERT now says that “operating system and some application updates mitigate these attacks.”   
    • Intel shares are up 0.2% premarket. 
    • Shares of competitor AMD (NASDAQ:AMD) are up 1.7%.

  • OHRP

    Ohr Pharma's MAKO study fails

    • Ohr Pharmaceutical (OHRP), a clinical-stage pharmaceutical company developing novel therapies for ophthalmic diseases, today reported topline data from the MAKO study which did not meet its primary efficacy endpoint. The MAKO study evaluated the efficacy and safety of topically administered squalamine in combination with monthly Lucentis injections for the treatment of wet age-related macular degeneration (“wet-AMD”). The primary efficacy endpoint was the mean visual acuity gain at nine months, using a mixed-effects model for repeated measures ("MMRM") analysis. Subjects receiving squalamine combination therapy (n=119) achieved a mean gain of 8.33 letters from baseline versus 10.58 letters from baseline with Lucentis monotherapy (n=118).
    • “We are very disappointed with the outcome of the MAKO study,” commented Dr. Jason Slakter, chief executive officer of Ohr. “Based on these results, we intend to evaluate strategic alternatives to maximize shareholder value.”
    • Shares of OHRP were down 3.5% in after-hours trading yesterday.
    • Source: Press Release
